mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Warner Lewis to George Washington, 1755 August 9
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lewis, Warner (1720-1779)
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Washington's friends in Williamsburg, including Speaker, desire to see him & have him accept command of troops to be raised--if he will proceed on expedition "twoud give a general satisfaction to our Country."--Assembly has voted Â£40,000 & 1200 men immed. raised --"I believe, were you present, that the greatest regard wou'd be shewn any proposals you shou'd think proper with regard to the expedition." Congratulations on his safe "arrival among us" [after Braddock's expedition] --condolences on his late illness. Autograph letter signed, 1 page, docketed "From Warner Lewis Esqr. without date" [in G.W.'s early handwriting ?], oversize document, laminated, watermark (crown over powder horn & LVG).
